arm_group.description: Karinat 500 mg tablet by mouth three times a day
Placebo tablet 500 mg by mouth three times a day

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the anti-atherosclerotic and anti-climacteric
      action of natural drug Karinat based on phytoestrogen-rich botanicals in perimenopausal
      women.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Anti-atherosclerotic and Estrogen-like Activity of Karinat in Perimenopausal Women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Perimenopausal women aged 45 to 60 years with intact womb and ovaries

          -  The absence of menstruations between 6 to 24 months

          -  Last menstruation after the age of 40 years

          -  Follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) blood level ≥ 35 ng/ml

          -  Mammography without nodal form of mastopathy or breast cancer signs

          -  Absence of hypolipidemic therapy or HRT (hormone replacement therapy) during 6 months
             before the inclusion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Administration of lipid-lowering drugs, and/or HRT, and/or phytoestrogens during 6
             month before inclusion

          -  Personal history or diagnostic of following diseases:

        nodal form of mastopathy or breast cancer any cancer except non-melanoma skin cancer
        stroke or myocardial infarction chronic renal failure II-III chronic hepatic failure
        II-III liver cirrhosis chronic heart failure IIa-III exacerbation of chronic stomach or
        duodenal ulcer obesity (BMI >30 kg/m2) alcohol abuse uncontrolled arterial hypertension
        (systolic blood pressure > 160 mmHg, diastolic blood pressure > 90 mmHg) current cigarette
        smoking (>10 cigarettes a day) diabetes mellitus deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary
        embolism

          -  Individual intolerance of Karinat or major side effects

intervention.description: Sugar pill manufactured to mimic Karinat 500 mg tablet

clinical_study.official_title: Double-blinded Placebo-controlled Multicenter Study of Anti-atherosclerotic and Estrogen-like Activity of Karinat in Perimenopausal Women

primary_outcome.description: Variation of intima-media thickness of common carotid arteries

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Change of the ability of serum to induce cholesterol accumulation in cultured cells

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Prevention
